message.content:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: public static void main(String[] args) {
    String line = "attribute1\tattribute2\tattribute3\tattribute4";
    StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(line, "\t");
    
    // Skip the first token
    st.nextToken();
    
    // Get the second token
    String secondToken = st.nextToken();
    System.out.println(secondToken);
    
    // Skip the third token
    st.nextToken();
    
    // Get the fourth token
    String fourthToken = st.nextToken();
    System.out.println(fourthToken);
}
<<<explanation>>>: In this code, we create a StringTokenizer object with the given line and tab delimiter. We then use the nextToken() method to skip the first token and print the second token. We then skip the third token and print the fourth token. This code avoids any redundant if checks and only retrieves the desired tokens from the line.
